|- wi(wi(wal(s0, wtru), wex(s0, wtru)), wex(s0, wtru))

comment: This implication, proved using only ~ ax-gen on top of propositional calculus (hence holding, up to the standard interpretation, in any modal logic), shows that the axiom scheme ` |- ( A. x ph -> E. x ph ) ` implies the axiom scheme ` |- E. x T. ` . These correspond to the modal axiom (D), and in predicate calculus, they assert that the universe of discourse is nonempty. For the converse, see ~ bj-axdd2 . (Contributed by BJ, 16-May-2019.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)
